issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch KitchenSink
2. Run Phone > Geolocation
3. Go back and then go back into geolocation again

Actual Result:
Alert "error{code

Expected Result:
To return the geolocation values

Note:
Droid 1 happens on first launch
Nexus S, sometimes happen on first launch, sometimes require a second launch
See also bug # 2418

Tested on:
Nexus S 2.3.2 Titanium SDK version: 1.7.0 (Apr 12 2011 15:24 rcc9dd9e1)
Droid 1 2.2.1 Titanium SDK version: 1.7.0 (Apr 12 2011 15:24 rcc9dd9e1)

{html}
fields.summary: Android: Geolocation displays error alert for Current location
fields.environment:
android 2.2.2
Ti SDK 2.0.x CI build
Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.9.201202141208

comments.body: Can not reproduce with latest master.

Reopening the bug. Able to reproduce it on Samsung Galaxy SIII (4.0.4) and Motorola RAZR i XT890 (4.0.4).
Not a regression, occurs on 2.1.4 and 2.1.3 as well.
Testing environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.0.201211131839
Titanium SDK, build: 3.0.0.v20121113170203
Devices: Samsung Galaxy SIII (4.0.4), Motorola RAZR i XT890 (4.0.4)

Still can not reproduce. Anyways what is the purpose of this bug. If the location manager can not give us a valid location we report an error. 

Devices
HTC EVO 4.0.3
Samsung SIII 4.1.1
MOT XT890 4.0.4
LG Nexus 4.2

SDK
master(3.1.0) and 3_0_X (3.0.2)

Issue is not reproducible, hence closing it

Verified on:
Device : Google Nexus 7,  Android Version: 4.1
SDK: 3.1.0.v20130409124549
CLI version : 3.1.0-cr
OS : MAC OSX 10.7.5
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.1.0.201304052347
XCode : 4.5.1
